sentences.en: " You're too prejudiced against Hsin - mei .
sentences.cn: “ 你对 辛楣 的偏见太深.

sentences.en: Basically prejudiced book calculated to make White Liberals feel comfortably indignant.
sentences.cn: 偏见的书,目的是使白人自由主义者看了生一点无伤大雅的气.

sentences.en: Early in my life , I was prejudiced against living in the country by some unfortunate experiences with farm animals.
sentences.cn: 由于几次不幸遭遇都与牲畜有关, 所以我幼年时对农村生活怀有偏见.

sentences.en: Environmentalists are prejudiced against the dam.
sentences.cn: 环境保护论者对那座水坝怀有成见。

sentences.en: Few people will admit to being racially prejudiced.
sentences.cn: 很少有人会承认自己有种族偏见。

sentences.en: He claimed his case would be prejudiced if it became known he was refusing to answer questions.
sentences.cn: 他声称如果大家都知道他拒绝回答问题，就会对他的案件抱有成见。

sentences.en: His bravado carried him too far and prejudiced his case.
sentences.cn: 他过分的虚张声势给他的诉讼带来了影响.

sentences.en: His honesty and sincerity prejudiced us in favour of him.
sentences.cn: 他的忠诚老实使我们对他产生好感.

sentences.en: His honesty and sincerity prejudiced us in his favour.
sentences.cn: 他的真诚使我们对他产生好感.

sentences.en: His manner prejudiced his audience in favour of him.
sentences.cn: 他的态度使听众对他发生了好感.

sentences.en: I think your South American youth has prejudiced you.
sentences.cn: 我认为你在南美度过的青少年时代让你产生了偏见。

sentences.en: Some landlords and landladies are racially prejudiced.
There is a class of men in Bristol monstrously prejudiced against Blandly.
sentences.cn: 布里斯托尔有那么一帮人为此恨透了布兰德利.

sentences.en: These facts prejudiced them against her.
sentences.cn: 这些事实促使他们对她有偏见.

sentences.en: What has prejudiced you against modern music?
sentences.cn: 是什么使你对现代音乐抱有成见?

sentences.en: You know that I am not a prejudiced man.
sentences.cn: 你知道我不是怀有偏见的人.

words.tran_cn: 不利的；有害的；引起偏见的
损害（prejudice的过去分词）；使抱偏见

trans.tran_cn: 怀偏见的，有成见的，偏颇的
trans.tran_en: having an unreasonable dislike of someone or something, especially a dislike of a group of people who belong to a different race, sex, or religion – used to show disapproval

trans.tran_cn: 损害(prejudice的过去分词)，使抱偏见
